description: Test case and tutorial example for INCOSE Requirements Workbench. This project demonstrates all features including hierarchical traceability, multiple requirement types, AI quality improvement, and DOORS-compatible export.

requirements.text: The homeowner shall be able to monitor the security status of their home remotely via a mobile application.
requirements.rationale: Primary user need identified in stakeholder interviews. Homeowners want peace of mind when away from home.

requirements.text: The system shall detect and alert the homeowner to unauthorized entry attempts within 30 seconds of detection.
requirements.rationale: Timely alerts are essential for effective security response. 30-second threshold based on industry benchmarks.
requirements.source: Stakeholder Interview #2, Security Industry Standards Review

requirements.text: The system shall operate continuously without requiring user intervention for routine maintenance.
requirements.rationale: Users expect set-and-forget operation. Maintenance burden reduces user satisfaction.

requirements.text: The system shall protect user privacy and comply with data protection regulations.
requirements.rationale: Legal compliance requirement. GDPR and local data protection laws apply.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall detect motion within the monitored area using passive infrared sensors with a detection range of 12 ± 1 m.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0002. PIR sensors provide reliable motion detection for residential applications.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall transmit alert notifications to the Mobile_Application within 5 ± 0.5 seconds of intrusion detection.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0002. 5-second transmission allows 25 seconds for user notification display, meeting the 30-second stakeholder requirement.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall provide a mobile application compatible with [iOS 15 AND Android 12] or later operating systems.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0001. Covers 95% of smartphone market as of 2025.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall encrypt data transmissions using AES-256 encryption.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0004. AES-256 is industry standard for secure communications.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall operate continuously for a minimum of 8760 hours (1 year) with availability ≥ 99.9%.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0003. 99.9% availability allows maximum 8.76 hours downtime per year.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall operate within an ambient temperature range of -10 °C to +50 °C.
requirements.rationale: Covers typical residential installation environments including garages and outdoor areas.

requirements.text: The Control_Panel shall have dimensions not exceeding 200 mm × 150 mm × 40 mm.
requirements.rationale: Size constraint for wall-mounted installation in residential settings.

requirements.text: The SHSS shall comply with EN 50131-1 Grade 2 for residential security systems.
requirements.rationale: Derived from STK-0004. European standard for electronic security systems.

requirements.text: The PIR_Sensor shall detect infrared radiation changes of ≥ 4 °C within the field of view.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0001. 4°C threshold discriminates human body heat from background.

requirements.text: The PIR_Sensor shall have a horizontal field of view of 110 ± 5 degrees.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0001. Wide angle reduces number of sensors needed per room.

requirements.text: The Communication_Module shall support Wi-Fi 802.11ac and cellular LTE-M connectivity.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0002. Dual connectivity provides redundancy if Wi-Fi fails.

requirements.text: The Communication_Module shall transmit sensor data packets within 500 ± 50 ms of receipt.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0002. Contributes to the 5-second end-to-end transmission budget.

requirements.text: The Mobile_Application shall display alert notifications within 2 ± 0.5 seconds of receipt from the cloud server.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0002. Final link in the notification chain.

requirements.text: The Mobile_Application shall display the current arm/disarm status of each zone on the home screen.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0003. Primary monitoring interface for users.

requirements.text: The Encryption_Module shall generate unique session keys for each communication session.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SYS-0004. Prevents replay attacks.

requirements.text: The PIR_Sensor_Element shall have a response time of ≤ 100 ms to infrared stimuli.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SUB-0001. Fast response enables rapid detection.

requirements.text: The Fresnel_Lens shall divide the field of view into a minimum of 34 detection zones.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SUB-0002. Multiple zones improve detection accuracy.

requirements.text: The Wi-Fi_Chip shall support data rates of ≥ 433 Mbps at 5 GHz.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SUB-0003. Adequate bandwidth for video streaming if cameras added.

requirements.text: The LTE_Modem shall support LTE Cat-M1 with maximum transmit power of 23 dBm.
requirements.rationale: Derived from SUB-0003. Cat-M1 optimized for IoT applications.

requirements.text: The system should be able to process data quickly and reliably, where possible.
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: vague terms (quickly, reliably), escape clause (where possible), superfluous infinitive (be able to).

requirements.text: Data shall be encrypted by the system.
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: passive voice.

requirements.text: The user shall configure the system settings including but not limited to alarm thresholds, notification preferences, etc.
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: user as subject (R3), open-ended clause (including but not limited to, etc.).

requirements.text: The system shall always respond immediately to all sensor inputs and shall never fail under any circumstances.
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: absolutes (always, never, all), vague temporal (immediately), multiple shalls (singularity).

requirements.text: The system shall use MySQL database and Python scripts running on AWS in order to store and process data efficiently
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: implementation details (MySQL, Python, AWS - violates R31 solution-free), purpose phrase (in order to), vague term (efficiently), missing period.

requirements.text: It shall notify them when something happens, as appropriate.
requirements.rationale: DELIBERATELY POOR - For testing AI improvement. Contains: pronouns (it, them, something), escape clause (as appropriate), vague.

requirements.text: The Backup_Battery shall provide a minimum of 24 hours of standby power at 25 °C.
requirements.rationale: ORPHAN REQUIREMENT - No parent trace. Tests orphan detection in traceability view.

requirements.text: The Siren shall produce an audible alarm of ≥ 100 dB at 1 m distance.
requirements.rationale: ORPHAN REQUIREMENT - No parent trace. Tests orphan detection in traceability view.

glossary.def: Smart Home Security System — the system under development
Passive Infrared — sensor technology that detects infrared radiation from warm objects
Long Term Evolution for Machines — cellular technology optimized for IoT devices
Advanced Encryption Standard with 256-bit key — symmetric encryption algorithm
System of Interest — the SHSS in this project context
Interface Control Document — defines interfaces between system components
Verification and Validation — processes to ensure requirements are met
Concept of Operations — describes how the system will be used
Mean Time Between Failures — reliability metric
European standard for alarm systems — electronic security systems
General Data Protection Regulation — EU data privacy law
Central unit housing the main processor and user interface
Smartphone app for remote monitoring and control
Subsystem handling all wireless communications
Subsystem responsible for data encryption/decryption
Motion detection sensor using passive infrared technology
Core sensing component within the PIR sensor
Optical lens that focuses infrared radiation onto the sensor element
Integrated circuit providing Wi-Fi connectivity
Component providing cellular network connectivity
